adrFormatAddress: Entrance On Corner Of 35th St, 444 10th Ave, New York, NY 10001, USA

editorialSummary.text: Refined lodging featuring a 24/7 gym, river views & a casual restaurant/bar serving craft beers.

originalText.text: Literally the cleanest hotel I've ever stayed at. No bed bugs, CLEAN room (literally the only hotel room I've ever stayed at clean enough to be barefoot. It feels like they disinfected the floors. Still wore socks just in case, but great), and the room has a lotion pump next to the hand soap?? Feels like a home away from home. It's in a quiet part of town, so not a lot of traffic or honking outside at night like other hotels in the area, but it's only a block away from the subway station, so everything is right there. There's even a pizza place a block away, 2 bros, that delivers CHEAP pizza. 99 cents a slice. Best hotel ever.

originalText.text: We loved the room. King bed was comfortable, and awesome shower. The only con is the check-in time, the line was huge, and our request for an earlier check-in was not honored. Excellent location close to the Penn Station and the 7 train.

text.text: We loved the room. King bed was comfortable, and awesome shower. The only con is the check-in time, the line was huge, and our request for an earlier check-in was not honored. Excellent location close to the Penn Station and the 7 train.

originalText.text: Recently spent 4 nights at this location and I really enjoyed my stay! The room is standard size for hotels in NYC but it had everything that I needed. This hotel is conveniently located to Hudson Yards and Times Square. I loved that it was not directly in the middle of the hustle and bustle of TS! On site business center and restaurant was nice to use. I enjoyed breakfast, cocktails, and dinner at the Hudson Bar onsite. I cannot say enough about the staff. Everyone that I interacted with was professional and courteous! I was able to enjoy a  quick chat with Gregory during check in, Bettye during checkout, and also the General Manager Lee after I checked out. They are all gems at this location. I’m a travel agent so I enjoy checking out different properties when in destination and this one will surely be at the top of my list for recommendations to clients for a great overall value!

originalText.text: Good location accessible to a lot of things in midtown.  The staff is excellent.  In general the hotel felt a little tight, and had a few maintenance issues although the rooms were updated.  For New York City, it's probably considered reasonable from a "value" perspective.

text.text: Good location accessible to a lot of things in midtown.  The staff is excellent.  In general the hotel felt a little tight, and had a few maintenance issues although the rooms were updated.  For New York City, it's probably considered reasonable from a "value" perspective.

originalText.text: If you have an event at the Javitz Center, this is your place to stay! Rooms were very nice. Every single person at the front desk we encountered was very cordial and helpful. There is a small bar with food and drink on site which is also very helpful. Would highly recommend.
